text: sooo sim is speaking out the former
chief constable of Northumbria the first
woman to lead a metropolitan force in
the UK has given an extraordinary
interview to the Daily Mail in which she
claims that the force is dominated by a
boys club
of greedy senior officers who believe
they are answerable to no one despite
the cuts facing the police she tells the
male that senior officers still have
first-class travel private drivers all
manner of bonuses and perks Suisun left
the force last year after what she says
was a campaign to get rid of her by
alleging misconduct and in turn an
external investigation then concluded
that she didn't have a case to answer
and suggested that she was the victim of
sexism the report wasn't published but
the male has seen a copy and Su sim is
on the line now good morning to you
paint paint a picture for us first of
all of how you say senior officers in
the Northumbria force behaved and are
still behaving I think the issue is that
a significant number of the senior
officers within within Northumbria
Police actually didn't like being led by
a woman particularly by a woman who had
very very demanding standards don't
forget I have always said that I had
very very high standards I was very very
honored to lead the police and I wanted
all of my officers and my senior
officers to deliver the absolute best
service we could to the communities of
Northumbria because that's what we were
there to do give it a second example
then of something you tried to do that
they push back on well one of the things
that I did was I stopped
first-class travel and of course that
was one of the things that in the
superintendence regulations they are
entitled to and a significant number of
them still wanted to claim it I refuse
to allow that to happen and the reason
for that is when you were talking about
the significant millions of pounds that
were going out of the budget of
Northumbria I wanted to keep as many of
the the
working officers at the CSA's the
constables the sergeants the people that
the communities want to see actually the
people that do the fantastic work for
Nathon Bria and I don't want anybody to
think that I am criticizing any of those

example of first-class travel
it goes wider than that doesn't it what
what you're alleging is essentially a
culture where the senior people don't
give a damn well that's it I mean the
problem with Northumbria is that it's a
very very isolated force right across
the country if you're looking at the
forces down in the south there's a
significant crossover of personnel
because lots and lots of people want to
go and live and work in the area now if
you want to come into Northumbria and I
would recommend everybody to it's a
fantastic wonderful place and the
communities are fantastic and I've
really enjoyed my time here but a lot of
people don't want to come in in policing
terms so it's very very isolated you had
senior officers who'd been here for 30
years who believed that they they knew
the way they wanted to do things and
unfortunately I came in from the outside
I wanted to change things I wanted to
make it very very clear and always did
make it clear that all my police
officers had access to me yes and they
did and they spoke to me I'd one of the
things I mean you said to yourself that
one of the things that people do this

following rules that are laid down
presumably by the Home Office I mean are

to be with the rules not with the men
and women of the force now what I wanted
was everybody should be working to make
sure that we could keep as many police

the public that was my view I wanted my
senior officers
to work with me I made sure you know
when I became the chief constable I
stopped having bonuses I didn't allow
any of my chief officers to have bonuses
and they didn't like that but my view I
was a committed public servant my view
was and remains that you need as many
police constables as many CSA's out
there and they deserve our backing and
unfortunately there are a series of

that they have the right to be where
they are and that they've worked there
and don't forget when when I joined 30
years ago that's exactly what happened
when you got to the top of the service
you were entitled to sit back and you're
entitled to to earn your keep when
you're saying has to say yeah none has

the other thing is you know and the

relentlessly is that it's so important
to change the culture of an organization
well some people might say it actually
the reason you're pursuing it is that

and my time has been and my time has

well
don't forget when I was the Chief

well why I'm doing this is finally when

indeed they reported that the
